Articles.Content:
I know we probably have a million of these by now, but I just built this today after spending several hours obsessing overy every last detail (as I am often wont to do). I used part clipping to enhance structural integrity and aesthetics, but not to increase fuel capacity. Aside from the KER module and one antenna from RemoteTech, this lander is completely stock! I haven't tested it on the Mun yet, but (in theory, at least) it has enough delta-v to manage it using the FAR-to-Stock KIDS setting (which scales back vacuum ISP by 20% or so). I will be happy to post the stockified craft file of enough people want it!

![0KqkaBT.png](http://i.imgur.com/0KqkaBT.png)

Thanks! I will post screens of the rest of my rocket when it's done!

While I wouldn't call this a replica, it's definitely really really Apollo-style and very tightly constructed with aesthetics obviously a chief design concern. I like this very much.

Good luck scarring the Mun's surface with your nasty burnt-out husk of a descent stage and a little tiny Kerbal flag. That's my favorite thing about Apollo-style landers.
